standards.description: The organization has an effective infection prevention and control program that is coordinated across all departments.

measurable_elements.text: The organization has an approved hand hygiene policy that is consistent with WHO guidelines and is reviewed annually.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Policy document must reference WHO five moments, include alcohol-based hand rub protocol, and show annual review date.

measurable_elements.text: Hand hygiene compliance rates are monitored monthly and reported to the Infection Control Committee.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Must show documented audit results for at least 6 months with >85% compliance target.

measurable_elements.text: Hand hygiene training is provided to all new staff during orientation and annually thereafter.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Training records must show >90% completion rate for new hires within 30 days.

measurable_elements.text: The organization has policies and procedures for cleaning, disinfection, and sterilization of medical devices and equipment.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Policy must include Spaulding classification, approved disinfectant list, and sterilization validation protocols.

measurable_elements.text: Biological indicators are used to monitor sterilization processes and results are documented.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Biological indicator testing logs must be available for each sterilizer, with results documented within 24 hours.

measurable_elements.text: The organization conducts surveillance of healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) using standardized definitions.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Surveillance program must cover at minimum: CLABSI, CAUTI, SSI, and VAP with monthly data collection.

measurable_elements.text: Infection rates are benchmarked against national and international standards.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Benchmarking reports must show comparison with NHSN or equivalent data, minimum quarterly.

standards.description: The organization implements a comprehensive patient safety program to prevent harm and improve outcomes.

measurable_elements.text: The organization has a patient identification policy that requires at least two patient identifiers before any intervention.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Policy must specify two identifiers, situations requiring verification, and corrective measures for misidentification.

measurable_elements.text: Compliance with patient identification protocols is monitored through regular audits.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Audit results must show >95% compliance and be conducted at minimum quarterly.

measurable_elements.text: The organization has a comprehensive fire safety plan including evacuation procedures, fire drills, and fire equipment maintenance.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Fire safety plan must include RACE/PASS protocols, evacuation routes, drill schedule (minimum biannual), and equipment inspection logs.

measurable_elements.text: Staff are trained in fire safety procedures including use of fire extinguishers and evacuation protocols.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Training records must show >90% staff participation in annual fire drills.

measurable_elements.text: The organization has a high-alert medications policy identifying medications that require additional safeguards.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Policy must include ISMP high-alert medication list, double-check procedures, and LASA medication management.

standards.description: The organization has a standardized, safe medication management system across the continuum of care.

measurable_elements.text: The organization has a formulary management system with a Pharmacy and Therapeutics Committee overseeing medication selection.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: P&T committee must meet at minimum quarterly with documented meeting minutes and formulary review.

measurable_elements.text: Medications are stored properly according to manufacturer requirements including temperature monitoring.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Temperature logs must be maintained for all medication storage areas, with documented corrective actions for excursions.

measurable_elements.text: The organization follows the '10 Rights' of medication administration with documented verification process.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Policy must enumerate all 10 rights, and audit results must show >95% compliance.

standards.description: Patients receive competent assessments and individualized care plans based on their needs.

measurable_elements.text: All patients receive an initial medical and nursing assessment within defined timeframes based on acuity.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Assessment timeframes must be defined: Emergency <30 min, Inpatient <24 hrs, with documented compliance.

measurable_elements.text: Pain assessment is conducted for all patients using validated tools and re-assessed regularly.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Must use validated pain scales appropriate to patient population, with documented reassessment intervals.

measurable_elements.text: Individualized care plans are developed collaboratively by the multidisciplinary team and documented in the patient record.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Care plans must be present in sampled records, signed by relevant disciplines, and updated within 72 hours.

standards.description: The leadership establishes governance structures and strategic plans that guide the organization.

measurable_elements.text: The organization has a documented strategic plan that addresses quality improvement, patient safety, and operational efficiency.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: Strategic plan must be current (within 3 years), include measurable objectives, and be approved by governing body.

measurable_elements.text: A hospital-wide quality improvement program is established with defined structure, process, and outcome measures.
measurable_elements.scoring_rule: QI program must include organizational structure, defined KPIs, regular meetings, and improvement projects.
